(Don't worry, I'm going to RP also. I did use Raszagal from Starcraft, I co=
uldn't think of a better name. But Archon isn't just from StarCraft, they a=
ctually existed. The definition is this "one of the nine chief officers of =
ancient city-state of Athens, elected annually after 683 B.C.E [Before Chri=
stian Era]" Zealot, Dragoon, Arbiter, Templar, they all really existed, mos=
t were religious warriors.)

::CyberShark::

    "Predacon base," CyberShar=
k said into his comm, hoping to reach someone in the base. "My name is Cybe=
rShark, I am here to discuss peace negations with whoever is in charge. Ple=
ase respond."
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: dcoburn 
  To: nbwrpg=
@egroups.com 
  Sent: Thursday, August 17, 2000 11:24 PM
  Subject: Starcra=
ft and Neo Beast Wars/Machines


  Listen everyone, I have been noting that=
 character names are coming from the totally wicked PC/N64 game, Starcraft.=
  Here are the names that I found:

  Neo Beast Wars RPG:
              -Ze=
rgling (Of the Zerg race, fast, cheap and effective in groups)

  Neo Beast=
 Machines RPG:
              -Raszagal (Leader of the Protoss Dark Templar =
who were banished from the Protoss homeworld, Aiur)
              -Archon (=
Of the Protoss race, two High Templars may merge into a psionic entity know=
n as an Archon.  Archons are really strong, and their movement isn't so bad=
)

  These 3 characters are all named after units in Starcraft(Raszagal is =
not a playable unit).  I guess Starcraft is more popular than I thought.  A=
nyway, I'm not saying that these names are cheap, I'm just pointing out tha=
t they are from Starcraft/Starcraft: Brood War/Starcraft 64.  

  NOTE: The=
 descriptions I put for these 3 guys are just from Starcraft, you don't hav=
e to use them for NBWRPG or NBMRPG.

--------------------------------------=

-----------------------------------------------
